Instance.description: The base class for all situations.

Tunable.name: _allow_external_autonomy
Tunable.description: If True, this situation will allow Sims external to the situation to autonomously run interactions on Sims in the situation. If False, Sims external to the situation will be discouraged from autonomously running interactions on Sims in the situation.

Tunable.name: _always_run_situation_ended_events
Tunable.description: If True, this situation should always run situation ended events. These normally only run for goaled situations, but will also run for non-goaled situations if this is checked.

TunableTuple.name: _buff
TunableTuple.description: Buff that will get added to sim when commodity is at this current state.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

Tunable.name: _cost
Tunable.description: The cost of this situation

Tunable.name: _default_job
Tunable.description: The default job for Sims in this situation

Tunable.name: _display_name
Tunable.description: Display name for situation

TunableVariant.name: _ensemble
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will keep Sims in a specific ensemble for the duration of the situation.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tunables for putting Sims into ensembles.

TunableEnum.name: ensemble_option
TunableEnum.description: How we want to add Sims to an ensemble: ONLY_WITHIN_SITUATION: Put the Sims in this situation into an ensemble of this type. Every time a sim is added we try and do this so if the user destroys the ensemble and then another Sim is spawned for it the ensemble will be recreated. ADD_TO_ACTIVE_HOUSEHOLD: Every time a Sim is spawned for this situation they are put into an ensemble with the instanced active household. This is useful if you want to put the Sims in a situation with someone who is not in it. ADD_TO_HOST: Every time a Sim is spawned for this situation they are put into an ensemble with the host of the situation. This is useful if you want to put the Sims in a situation with someone who is not in it.

Tunable.name: ensemble_type
Tunable.description: The type of Ensemble to put the sims into.

Tunable.name: ignore_situation_removal
Tunable.description: If checked then we will not remove the Sim from the ensemble of this type when the Sim is removed from the situation.

Tunable.name: remove_before_add
Tunable.description: If checked then before we add the Sim to the ensemble we will remove them from from ensembles of the specified type. This can be used to force Sims into only an ensemble of Sims in this situation.

Tunable.name: _hidden_scoring_override
Tunable.description: If checked then even if this situation has its scoring disabled it still will count score and provide rewards to the player.

Tunable.name: _icon
Tunable.description: Icon to be displayed in the situation UI.

Tunable.name: _implies_greeted_status
Tunable.description: If checked then a sim, in this situation, on a residential lot they do not own, is consider greeted on that lot. Greeted status related design documents: //depot/Sims4Projects/docs/Design/Gameplay/HouseholdState/Ungreeted_Lot_Behavior_DD.docx //depot/Sims4Projects/docs/Design/Gameplay/Simulation/Active Lot Changing Edge Cases.docx

TunableList.name: _initiating_sim_tests
TunableList.description: A set of tests that will be run on a sim attempting to initiate a situation. If these tests do not pass then this situation will not be able to be chosen from the UI. If the tooltip is enabled, the next button will be greyed out with it in the Situation Creation UI along with the situation cell and checkbox in the list, otherwise it will not show on failure. Actor will be the initiating Sim and when targeted, the TargetSim will be the target. If you'd like to tune a test with a target only when the situation is targeted, please see Tests tunable in Targeted Situation tuning.

TunableVariant.description: A single tunable test.

TunableTuple.name: region
TunableTuple.description: A test to check which region the actor sim is in.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a blacklist of regions in insure that the sim is not within one of them.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of regions that the sim being tested must not be within.

Tunable.description: A region that the sim being tested in must not be within.

TunableVariant.name: subject
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will test the region of the specified participant type. Otherwise we will test the current region.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Who do we want to run this test on.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a whitelist of regions in insure that the sim is within one of them.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of regions that the sim being tested must be within.

Tunable.description: A region that the sim being tested in must be within.

TunableTuple.name: relationship
TunableTuple.description: Relationship test where the Actor will be the initiating Sim and when targeted, the TargetSim will be the target. If the test is tuned when not targeted, TargetSim should not be tuned here.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

Tunable.name: must_have_track
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sims actually have the tuned relationship track. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sims have the relationship track at the value of 0.

Tunable.name: num_relations
Tunable.description: Number of Sims with specified relationships required to pass, default(0) is all known relations. If value set to 1 or greater, then test is looking at least that number of relationship to match the criteria. If value is set to 0, then test will pass if relationships being tested must match all criteria of the test to succeed. For example, if interaction should not appear if any relationship contains a relationship bit, this value should be 0.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableList.name: target_sim
TunableList.description: Target(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info
TunableTuple.description: The SimInfo tests some of the basic aspects of a Sim, such as their age, gender, or species.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: death_object_assigned
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim's death object (urnstone) has been assigned to it's tracker. This happens in the normal death flow, but is skipped from CAS or Gallery.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim's death object (urnstone) has been assigned to it's tracker. This happens in the normal death flow, but is skipped from CAS or Gallery.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableVariant.name: has_been_played
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableVariant.name: is_active_sim
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description: When testing multiple participants if MATCH_ALL is set, then all the participants need to pass the test. If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass as soon as one of them meet the criteria

TunableVariant.name: npc
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored. Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored. Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableTuple.name: specified_extended
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: ' Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: skill_tag
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks the TAGS of ALL THE PARTICIPANTS SKILLS each against a threshold.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the result of this test will be flipped so that a test that would return True will now return False and vice versa.

Tunable.name: skill_quantity
Tunable.description: The minimum number of skills at or above this level required to pass.

TunableEnum.name: skill_tag
TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold level to test of each skill.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: test_only_changed_skill
Tunable.description: If checked then we will only test the skill that actually changed.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant. It can also test whether or not the participant has the statistic explicitly added on them.

Tunable.name: must_have_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.name: state_value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The state threshold for this test.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: test_all_sims_against_filter
TunableTuple.description: Test all sims to see if there are any sims that match the filter. Passes if any sims match the filter.

Tunable.name: duration_available
Tunable.description: The duration from now that will be used for the start and end time of the filter request.

Tunable.name: in_current_zone
Tunable.description: If enabled, check if any matching Sims are in the current zone.

Tunable.name: include_missing_pets
Tunable.description: If unchecked, missing pet sims will be removed even if they pass the filters and tests. If checked, they will be included if they pass the filters and tests. Please leave unchecked if the filter they are used with can also spawn the pet sim

Tunable.name: include_rabbithole_sims
Tunable.description: If unchecked, rabbithole sims will be removed even if they pass the filters and tests. If checked, they will be included if they pass the filters and tests. Please leave unchecked if the filter they are used with can also spawn the sim

TunableVariant.name: threshold_matched
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will require the number of Sims that match the filter pass the threshold requirement. Otherwise we require all Sims that the filter runs on to match. This is useful if you only need one or a number of Sims to match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold of how many sims should match the filter.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold for how many Sims should match the filter.

TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: in_current_zone

Tunable.name: include_rabbithole_sims
Tunable.description: If unchecked, rabbithole sims will be removed even if they pass the filters and tests. If checked, they will be included if they pass the filters and tests. Please leave unchecked if the filter they are used with can also spawn the sim

TunableVariant.name: threshold_matched
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will require the number of Sims that match the filter pass the threshold requirement. Otherwise we require all Sims that the filter runs on to match. This is useful if you only need one or a number of Sims to match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold of how many sims should match the filter.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: Test to require a Sim to have or not have certain specific traits.

Tunable.name: apply_thresholds_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description: If checked then Num Whitelist Required and Num Blacklist Allowed will be applied to each individual participant from the subject. If unchecked then it will apply the values to the total whitelist and blacklist matches on the group. IMPORTANT!!! In the case of objectives this should probably be set to false since we know that this is coming from only one sim and that we want to use the value that comes out of the test result numeric. This isn't just locked to being this value since there are valid cases within that system when you are looking at a group of sims and could want to test that one of your sims passes. Ex. Having a ghost sim in the household.

TunableList.name: blacklist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to not have traits of these types to pass this test. Should Num Blacklist Allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

TunableList.name: blacklist_traits
TunableList.description: The is required to not have traits from this list in order to pass this test. Should num_blacklist_allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

Tunable.description: A blacklist trait.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist traits owned by the specified Sim that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist traits that the specified Sim is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableList.name: whitelist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits with these types in order to pass the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_traits
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits from this list in order to pass the test.

Tunable.description: A whitelist trait. Please note: for pack-safe entries that are not loaded, the game will behave as if the entry doesn't exist. This allows you to specify a pack trait and required count of 1 and always fail the test should the appropriate pack not be installed.

TunableTuple.name: travel_group
TunableTuple.description: A test to check the number of available Sim slots in a participant's travel group.

TunableVariant.name: hosted_travel_group
TunableVariant.description: If Enabled and Checked, only a travel group hosted at the participants home lot will be considered. If Enabled and Unchecked, we will consider a hosted travel group or a travel group the sim/household is part of. If Disabled we will only consider a travel group the sim/household is part of. Note: A household can only either be in a travel group or hosting a travel group, not both.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, only include any travel group staying at the participants home lot.

Tunable.name: include_household_travel_group
Tunable.description: If checked, the travel group that any sims in the participant's household will be used in the event that the participant is not actually on vacation.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to determine what about this travel group's size we care about.

TunableTuple.name: can_extend
TunableTuple.description: Use this option to check whether or not a participant can extend their vacation. This test will fail if the participant is not in a travel group or their travel group does not have an end time specified.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing for a specific number of free slots in the travel group.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of required free slots for the specified travel group.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The range of required free slots.

TunableTuple.name: in_travel_group
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when testing to see if a travel group exists as specified relative to the participant.

Tunable.name: exists
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will fail if no travel group related to the participant as specified exists. If unchecked, this test will fail if one does exist.

TunableTuple.name: includes_target_participant
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when testing to see whether or not a target sim is in a travel group related to the participant as specified.

Tunable.name: in_group
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will fail if the target participant is not in the travel group. If unchecked, this test will fail if the target is in the travel group.

TunableEnum.name: target_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be tested.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing a specific Sim being added to the travel group.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be added.

TunableTuple.name: stayover_room
TunableTuple.description: Use this option to check whether there is enough room on the participant's lot to host a stayover.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_to_test
TunableVariant.description: The unlocked aspiration, career, achievement, or milestone want to test for.

TunableTuple.name: aspiration
TunableTuple.description: This option tests for completion of a tuned Aspiration.

Tunable.name: aspiration

Tunable.name: negate

TunableTuple.name: aspiration_unlocked
TunableTuple.description: Test the actual aspiration that is being unlocked.

TunableVariant.name: check_aspiration_type
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check the aspiration type of the aspiration that was just unlocked.

TunableVariant.name: check_complete_only_in_sequence

Tunable.name: negate

TunableTuple.name: build_buy_reward_earned

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if the Build/Buy object is still locked.

Tunable.name: object_definition
Tunable.description: Tests if the specified Object Definition has been unlocked in Build/Buy. This test will NOT work for Build Buy objects that are always unlocked. It needs to have been locked before and unlocked through something like a Build Buy Object Reward.

TunableTuple.name: household_milestone_earned
TunableTuple.description: Helper class for Unlock Earned test that tests a reference to a household milestone.

Tunable.name: household_milestone
Tunable.description: The household milestone to check unlock status against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if the milestone is not complete otherwise it will pass if it's been earned.

Tunable.name: _is_unique
Tunable.description: If set, only a single instance of this situation can exist at once in a given zone.

TunableList.name: _jobs_with_additional_pets
TunableList.description: A mapping from situation jobs to pet info, you can specify what situation jobs can bring additional pets and what pets they can bring.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Icon that is displayed on the situation UI's progress bar when this level has been reached. If left unspecified, icon will default to a generic medal icon appropriate for the level.

Tunable.name: level_description

TunableVariant.name: _main_goal_visibility_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the main goal of the situation will not be visible until this test passes. If the state of this test no longer becomes true then the main gaol will not become invisible again. Ex. A hospital emergency starting triggers the visiblity of the main goal within the active career event situation. IMPORTANT: The nature of this test can cause performance problems.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: A single tunable test.

TunableTuple.name: situation_running_test
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if the participant is part of any situations that are running that satisfy the conditions of the test.

TunableVariant.name: level
TunableVariant.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: situation_blacklist
TunableVariant.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tag in Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: situation_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: tag_blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: tag_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If this whitelist is not enabled, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The test event that this test will run on when tuned within an objective or the main goal trigger of a sitaution. If you are tuning this on an interaction then it will do nothing.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: _maintain_sims_consistency
Tunable.description: If checked, Sims in the saved situation that were pushed home because they had been saved in the zone for many Sim hours will be back. Otherwise, we will find replacement. Ex. We don't want to replace Butler with new Sim if previous Butler is no longer in the lot.

TunableList.name: _relationship_between_job_members
TunableList.description: Whenever a sim joins either job_x or job_y, the sim is granted the tuned relationship bit with every sim in the other job. The relationship bits are added and remain as long as the sims are assigned to the tuned pair of jobs. This creates a relationship between the two sims if one does not exist. E.g. Date situation uses this feature to add bits to the sims' relationship in order to drive autonomous behavior during the lifetime of the date.

TunableList.name: relationship_bits_to_add
TunableList.description: A set of RelationshipBits to add to relationship between the sims.

Tunable.name: _resident_job
Tunable.description: The job to assign to members of the host sims household. Make sure to use the in_family filter term in the filter of the job you reference here. It is okay if this tunable is None.

Tunable.name: _supports_automatic_bronze
Tunable.description: If True, the situation will allow automatic bronze traits on the host Sim to promote the score to bronze at the start. Primarily for event-hosted situations.

Tunable.name: _survives_active_household_change
Tunable.description: If checked then this situation will load even if the active household has changed since it was saved. It will attempt to restore Sims to their saved jobs. This is primarily useful for commercial venue background situations.

Tunable.name: _use_spawner_tags_on_travel
Tunable.description: If checked the situation will spawn sims according to its job spawner tags instead of always defaulting to the player Arrival spawner.

TunableList.name: activity_goals
TunableList.description: Goals that will be set based off activities chosen. Ideally, there should be goals for each of the activities in available_activities. When one or more is tuned here with Activity Situation Goal Tracker, the activity goal icon shows for the situation cell in Situation Creation UI.

Tunable.name: Activity
Tunable.description: An available activity for this Situation.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: Weighted list of goals associated with this activity.

Tunable.name: goal
Tunable.description: A goal in the set.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: Higher number means higher chance of being selected.

TunableVariant.name: activity_selection
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning activities that can be selected in the Situation Creation UI. Those activities will be displayed during the Situation Creation.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Activities that can be chosen for this Situation.

TunableList.name: available_activities
TunableList.description: A set of available activities from which the player can choose.

Tunable.description: An available activity for this Situation.

Tunable.name: preferred_activity_footer
Tunable.description: The footer used to indicate the reason the activity is preferred. This string should include a Sim name token that will be populated by the sim with a preference.

Tunable.name: preferred_activity_icon
Tunable.description: The sub-icon that will be shown on the Available Activity cell if the Situation considers it 'preferred'.

TunableVariant.name: randomize_activities
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning a set of Situation Activities that can be randomized from selecting the dice button in Situation Creation UI for this Situation. Randomization clears player activity selections but not Required Activities.

Tunable.name: num_randomized
Tunable.description: The number of activities to be randomized out of the randomizable activities when the dice button is selected. This number must not be greater than the number of randomizable activities.

TunableList.name: randomizable_activities
TunableList.description: A set of activities that can be randomized for this Situation. An activity tuned here must also be tuned in Available Activities.

Tunable.description: An activity that can be randomized for this Situation.

TunableVariant.name: required_activities
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning a set of Situation Activities that are required for this Situation.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of activities that will be required for this Situation.

Tunable.description: An activity required for this Situation.

TunableVariant.name: role_updates_activity_preferences
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the assignment of this role will trigger updating the Activities Panel.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The job that triggers an Activities Panel update.

Tunable.name: allow_multiple_instances
Tunable.description: If checked, multiple instances of the situation are allowed. For example, if two Sims are allowed to travel and go to high school together and both run the situation, this should be checked. The check will test if this has been checked or if Situation Display Type Override is in the tuned list of Multi Instance Situation Display Types from situation_manager.

Tunable.name: allowed_in_super_speed_3
Tunable.description: If enabled, this situation will skip the super speed 3 rules and be allowed to trigger at that speed. This will only affect walkby's as they are the only restricted by speed 3.

Tunable.name: audio_sting_on_start
Tunable.description: The sound to play when the Situation starts.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will play audio in the background while this user facing situation is running.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Audio that will play throughout the situation in the background and will end at the end of the situation.

Tunable.name: blocks_super_speed_three
Tunable.description: If enabled, this situation will block any requests to go into super speed 3.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_lock_reason
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then build buy will be disabled during this situation.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason build buy is locked. For this case, it is because build buy is not allowed during active career. Used on the disabled buildbuy button in the HUD.

TunableVariant.name: calendar_alert_description
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, there will be a calendar alert description.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Description that shows up in the calendar alert.

Tunable.name: calendar_icon
Tunable.description: Icon to be displayed in the calendar UI.

Tunable.name: can_be_replaced
Tunable.description: If checked, the situation can be replaced by a situation with the same situation display type when 1 is currently running and multiple instances are not allowed, for example if a date situation is running which has display type overridden to be ROMANCE and then the player clicks OK from player planned drama node to start a previously planned date, the current situation will cancel and the planned one will begin.

Tunable.name: can_be_sent_home_in_super_speed_3
Tunable.display: Can Be Sent Home In Super Speed 3
Tunable.description: If disabled, this sim will never be sent home by a transition into SS3, despite being on the lot or not.

Tunable.name: can_remove_sims_from_work
Tunable.description: If checked then this situation will cause sims to end work early when they are on the guest list. If unchecked, it will not. This option will not affect active career situations or NPC career situations like tending the bar.

TunableVariant.name: cancel_tooltip_override
TunableVariant.description: When enabled will override the default tooltip text for the cancel button which is based on the situation display type.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The string to display as the tooltip.

TunableEnum.name: category
TunableEnum.description: The Category that the Situation belongs to.

TunableList.name: compatible_venues
TunableList.description: In the Plan an Event UI, lots that are these venues will be added to the list of lots on which the player can throw the event. The player can always choose their own lot and lots of their guests.

TunableEnum.name: creation_ui_option
TunableEnum.description: Determines if the situation can be created from the Plan Event UI triggered from the phone. NOT_AVAILABLE - situation is not available in the creation UI. AVAILABLE - situation is available in the creation UI. DEBUG_AVAILABLE - situation is only available in the UI if you have used the |situations.allow_debug_situations command SPECIFIED_ONLY - situation is available in the creation UI if that UI is tuned to only look at a subset of situations.

TunableVariant.name: customizable_style
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows the player to customize the guest attire and outfits of certain roles.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A references to SituationStyleData that defines the style options for this Situation.

TunableVariant.name: disabled_interaction_tooltip

Tunable.name: enabled

Tunable.name: disallows_curfew_violation
Tunable.description: If this is checked then the Sim is unable to violate curfew while in the situation. If this is not checked then the Sim can vioalte curfew as normal.

TunableVariant.name: display_special_object

TunableList.description: A list of loots that will be applied when the player selects this response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the tooltip text to be shown on hover for this button.

Tunable.description: The tooltip's text.

TunableVariant.name: tutorial_id
TunableVariant.description: If set, this tutorial ID will be used for SHOW_LESSONS requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: ID of a Tutorial, TutorialCategory, or TutorialSubcategory to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_name
TunableVariant.description: If set, this UI message will be used for SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Name of a UI message to be sent.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: recommended_job_object_text
Tunable.description: The text of the notification that is displayed when one or more recommended objects for a job are missing. The localization tokens for the Text field are: {0.String} = bulleted list of strings for the missing objects

Tunable.name: run_carry_fixup_on_destroy
Tunable.description: If True, we will run carry fixup commands on all situation sims when the situation is being destroyed. For example, we set this to True on situation_Career_InteriorDecorator_HideClients, so interior decorator clients will come back with their infants being held.

TunableVariant.name: scoring_lock_reason
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, when the situation is shown in social event UI, the 'Goaled Event' checkbox will be greyed out and can't be changed. This reason text will be shown as a tooltip.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableVariant.description: Screen slam to show when this situation is completed and a bronze medal is earned. Localization Tokens: Event Name - {0.String}, Medal Awarded - {1.String}

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Tunable Screen Slams!

Tunable.name: active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If true, the screen slam will be only be shown if the active Sim triggers it.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: A sting to play at the same time as the screen slam. ***Some screen slams may appear to play a sting, but the audio is actually tuned on something else. Example: On CareerLevel tuning there already is a tunable, Promotion Audio Sting, to trigger a sting, so one is not necessary on the screen slam. Make sure to avoid having multiple stings play simultaneously.***

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

Tunable.name: should_send_on_lot_home_in_super_speed_3
Tunable.display: Should Send On Lot Home In Super Speed 3
Tunable.description: If enabled, on_lot sims in this situation will not prevent SS3. If SS3 is triggered they will be sent home.

Tunable.name: show_timer_in_scored_situation
Tunable.description: If this is checked, then the situation timer will display in scored situations.

TunableVariant.name: sim_filter_requesting_sim_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the sim chosen for this job in the Situation Creation panel will be used as the 'Requesting Sim' for Sim Filters.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The job of the sim who should be considered the 'Requesting Sim'.

Tunable.name: situation_cancelable
Tunable.description: Defaults to True. When True, the player may cancel the situation via the situation UI. When False, the UI will display the timer if set, but will not allow the player to cancel the situation.

Tunable.name: situation_description
Tunable.description: Situation Description

TunableVariant.name: situation_display_description
TunableVariant.description: Description displayed on the situation display component in the top left of screen.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableVariant.name: situation_display_type_override
TunableVariant.description: Tune to override the value of the situation display type. By default, this is set to be NORMAL on base situations. If this is enabled and the display type is tuned in Multi Instance Situation Display Types in situation_manager, multiple instances will be allowed (Allow Multiple Instances tuning on this situation will also effect this).

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The display type used by UI to determine the Situation Display format.

TunableVariant.name: situation_end_time_string
TunableVariant.description: When disabled the situation end time will not be shown. When enabled the situation end time will be displayed above the score bar. The string displayed will be the tuned string.

Tunable.name: show_end_time
Tunable.description: The string to display as the situation end time string.

Tunable.name: situation_location_description
Tunable.description: A description of the venue locations the situation is allowed to be held on.

Tunable.name: situation_main_objective
Tunable.description: A description of the situation's main objective to show when the situation's scoring checkbox ('Goaled/ Activity Event') is checked in the Situation Creation UI.

TunableVariant.name: super_speed3_replacement_speed
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and this situation blocks super speed 3, the situation will attempt to request this speed if it is running when super speed 3 tries to kick in.

Tunable.name: suppress_scoring_progress_bar
Tunable.description: If this is checked, UI will no longer show the scoring progress bar and instead show the situation name in its stead.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: Tags for arbitrary groupings of situation types.

TunableVariant.name: targeted_situation
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the situation can be used as a targeted situation, such as a Date. When Targeted Situation is enabled, the Actor and Target will be pre-populated and locked into the jobs tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuning specific to targeted situations, such as the date.

Tunable.name: actor_job
Tunable.description: This is the job for the actor sim, usually the one doing the asking. A sim will only be able to initiate this situation if they match the filter in this job and pass the initiating_sim_tests (another tuning field on situations). It will be common for the filter in this job to be None. This field is required for targeted situations.

Tunable.name: override_targeted_situation
Tunable.description: If checked, a situation with Targeted Situation tuning enabled will be considered not targeted when checking availability and no target Sim is found. This is useful in cases where we want this situation in Situation Creation UI from both an interaction on a Sim where we want it targeted and also from the phone/calendar where we do not want it targeted (no pre-selected Sims and no locking in roles).

Tunable.name: target_job
Tunable.description: This is the job for the target sim, usually the one being asked. After a player selects a target sim they will be given a list of situations to choose from. Only situations in which their selected sim matches the filter on this job will be included. This field is required for targeted situations.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that will only run when the situation is targeted. If these tests do not pass then this situation will not be able to be chosen from the UI. If the tooltip is enabled, the next button will be greyed out with it in the Situation Creation UI along with the situation cell and checkbox in the list, otherwise it will not show on failure. Actor will be the initiating Sim and the TargetSim will be the target. Initiating Sim Tests will be run first.

TunableVariant.name: time_jump
TunableVariant.description: Determine how the situation handles the zone time being different on load than what it was on save. This is primarily useful for commercial venue background situations and career event situations.

TunableTuple.name: allow
TunableTuple.description: Time jumping is allowed for this situation. The situation will last for as long as it was intended to last upon load. It is completely insensitive to the time jump.

TunableTuple.name: disallow
TunableTuple.description: Time jumping is disallowed for this situation. Any situations would be discarded upon load.

TunableTuple.name: gig_based
TunableTuple.description: Time Jump can be allowed or disallowed if any household Sim has the tuned gig.

Tunable.name: gig
Tunable.description: The gig house Sims must have in order for this situation to time jump.

Tunable.name: time_jump_allowed
Tunable.description: If checked, time jump is allowed if any household Sim has the tuned Gig and disallowed if no Sims are on the tuned Gig. If unchecked, time jump is disallowed if any household Sim has the tuned Gig and allowed if no Sims are on the tuned Gig.

TunableTuple.name: simulate
TunableTuple.description: Time will simulate upon load for this situation. If the time jump is greater than the situation's duration, the situation will not load. The situation is informed of the time jump, and should progress states accordingly, should it desire to do so.

TunableVariant.name: travel_request_behavior
TunableVariant.description: Define how this situation handles incoming travel requests from other situations when running as user-facing.

TunableTuple.name: allow
TunableTuple.description: The situation allows traveling. If desired, a prompt can be displayed requiring player confirmation.

TunableVariant.name: dialog
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, display a prompt requiring player confirmation. If disabled, immediately end this situation and allow the travel request to go through.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A simple Ok/Cancel Dialog. Its result will be True if the user selected Ok, False if the user selected Cancel or if the dialog timed out.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the audio event sent by the Cancel button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The Cancel button audio event name.

TunableVariant.name: audio_ok
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the audio event sent by the Ok button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The Ok button audio event name.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting_owner
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the owner of the audio sting when the dialog is shown.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to any weight this situation might have as part of a Situation Curve. These multipliers will be applied globally anywhere this situation is tuned as part of a situation curve (i.e. Walkby Tuning) so it should only be used in cases where you ALWAYS want this multiplier applied. NOTE: You can still tune more multipliers on the individual walk by instances. The multipliers will all stack together. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.
